item.title: Get the Roughtime
item.description: Get the RoughtimeThe “Hello, world!” of Roughtime is very simple: the client sends a request over UDP to the server and the server responds with a signed timestamp. You just need the server’s address and public key to run the protocol: Server address: roughtime.cloudflare.com:2002 (resolves to an IP address in our anycast IP range External link icon Open external link ). You can use either IPv4 or IPv6. Public key: gD63hSj3ScS+wuOeGrubXlq35N1c5Lby/S+T7MNTjxo= To get started, download and run Cloudflare’s Go client External link icon Open external link :

item.title: Use Roughtime
item.description: Use RoughtimeThere are various ways you can use Roughtime to keep your clock in sync. These recipes use Cloudflare’s Go package External link icon Open external link , which is based on Google’s Go client External link icon Open external link . The protocol is also implemented in C++ External link icon Open external link , Rust External link icon Open external link , and Java External link icon Open external link .
